org.wikipedia.miner.model
Class Wikipedia

java.lang.Object
  org.wikipedia.miner.model.Wikipedia

public class Wikipedia
extends java.lang.Object

This class serves as the main portal into a Wikipedia database, and is intended to provide convenient methods for analysing it's content.

Author:
David Milne

Constructor Detail

Wikipedia

public Wikipedia(java.lang.String databaseServer,
                 java.lang.String databaseName,
                 java.lang.String userName,
                 java.lang.String password)
          throws java.lang.Exception
Initializes a newly created Wikipedia and attempts to make a connection to the mysql database defined by the arguments given. In addition, it will check that the wikipedia database is complete; that all necessary tables and indexes exist.

Parameters:
databaseServer - the connection string for the server (e.g 130.232.231.053:8080 or bob:8080)
databaseName - the name of the database (e.g enwiki)
userName - the user for the sql database (null if anonymous)
password - the users password (null if anonymous)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

Returns the wikipedia database that this Wikipedia instance is connected to

Returns:
the wikipedia database

                                throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the root Category (Fundamental), from which all other categories can be browsed.

Throws:

getPageById

public Page getPageById(int id)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the Page referenced by the given id. The page can be cast into the appropriate type for more specific functionality.

Parameters:
id - the id of the Page to retrieve.
Returns:
the Page referenced by the given id, or null if one does not exist.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database.

getArticleByTitle

public Article getArticleByTitle(java.lang.String title)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the Article referenced by the given (case sensitive) title. If the title matches a redirect, this will be resolved to return the redirect's target. The given title must be matched exactly to return an article. If you want some more leeway, use getMostLikelyArticle() instead.

Parameters:
title - the title of an Article (or it's redirect).
Returns:
the Article referenced by the given title, or null if one does not exist
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database

getCategoryByTitle

public Category getCategoryByTitle(java.lang.String title)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the Category referenced by the given (case sensitive) title. The given title must be matched exactly to return a Category.

Parameters:
title - the title of an Article (or it's redirect).
Returns:
the Article referenced by the given title, or null if one does not exist
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database

getMostLikelyArticle

public Article getMostLikelyArticle(java.lang.String term,
                                    MorphologicalProcessor mp)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the most likely article for a given term. For example, searching for "tree" will return the article "30579: Tree", rather than "30806: Tree (data structure)" or "7770: Christmas tree" This is defined by the number of times the term is used as an anchor for links to each of these destinations. An optional morphological processor (may be null) can be used to alter the way anchor texts are retrieved (eg via stemming or casefolding)

Parameters:
term - the term to obtain articles for
mp - an optional morphologicalProcessor to modify how the term is searched for.
Returns:
the most likely sense of the given term.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database

getWeightedArticles

public SortedVector<Article> getWeightedArticles(java.lang.String term,
                                                 MorphologicalProcessor mp)
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns a SortedVector of all Articles which are about the given term, sorted by how well known they are as a sense of the term. For example, searching for "club" returns the article about associations of people, followed by articles about nightclubs, football teams, the type of weapon, etc. This order is calculated from the number of times the text is used to link to each article; The most obvious well-known sense (the one which is the destination for most "club" links) is first in the list. An optional morphological processor (may be null) can be used to alter the way anchor texts are retrieved (e.g. via stemming or casefolding)

Parameters:
term - the term to obtain articles for
mp - the morphologicalProcessor by which the term is compared to wikipedia anchors.
Returns:
the SortedVector of all relevant Articles, ordered by commoness of the link being made.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database

getWeightedArticles

public SortedVector<Article> getWeightedArticles(java.lang.String term,
                                                 MorphologicalProcessor mp,
                                                 java.util.Collection<Article> contextArticles)
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns a SortedVector of all Articles which are about the given term, sorted by how well known they are as a sense of the term, and how strongly they relate to the given context articles. For example, searching for "club" returns "10830: Football team" at the top of the list if you provide "3928: Ball" and "26853: Sport" as context, and "305482: Nightclub" if you provide "18839: Music" and "7885: Dance". An optional morphological processor (may be null) can be used to alter the way anchor texts are retrieved (e.g. via stemming or casefolding)

Parameters:
term - the term to obtain articles for
mp - the morphologicalProcessor by which the term is compared to wikipedia anchors.
contextArticles - a collection of articles that relate to the intended meaning of the term.
Returns:
the SortedVector of all relevant Articles, ordered how well-known they are and how they relate to context articles.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database

getWeightedArticles

public SortedVector<Article> getWeightedArticles(java.lang.String term,
                                                 MorphologicalProcessor mp,
                                                 java.lang.String[] contextTerms)
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns a SortedVector of all Articles which are about the given term, sorted by how well known they are as a sense of the term, and how strongly they relate to the given context terms. This is just a convenience method, which resolves each term with getMostLikelyArticle(), and then calls the above method. An optional morphological processor (may be null) can be used to alter the way anchor texts are retrieved (eg via stemming or casefolding)

Parameters:
term - the term to obtain articles for
mp - the morphologicalProcessor by which the term is compared to wikipedia anchors.
contextTerms - an array of phrases or terms that relate to the intended meaning of the term.
Returns:
the SortedVector of all relevant Articles, ordered by commoness of the link being made and relatedness to context articles.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if there is a problem with the wikipedia database

getInstanceFromArguments

public static Wikipedia getInstanceFromArguments(java.lang.String[] args)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
A convenience method that returns an instance of Wikipedia, initialized according to the given array of String arguments.

Parameters:
args - an array at least 2 String arguments; the connection string of the wikipedia database server, the name of the wikipedia database and (optionally, if annonymous access is not allowed) a username and password.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the arguments are invalid, or if there is a problem connecting to the database.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Provides a demo of the functionality provided by this toolkit.

Parameters:
args - an array of 2 or 4 String arguments; the connection string of the wikipedia database server, the name of the wikipedia database and (optionally, if annonymous access is not allowed) a username and password for the database.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
